com.esri.mo2.map.dpy
Interface FeatureLayer

All Superinterfaces:
Cloneable, DatasetLayer, Layer, Searchable, Selectable, SelectableLayer
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseFeatureLayer
public interface FeatureLayer
extends DatasetLayer, SelectableLayer

A FeatureLayer implements a visual representation of a particular FeatureClass. When a FeatureLayer is asked to draw itself, it creates an appropriate MapFilter then passes this to each of the Renderer and SelectionSymbol in turn for drawing.

There are three phases of the rendering (1) the un-selected features are drawn (2) the selected features are drawn (3) the text labelling is drawn. Each phase is identified by one of the enumerated values DRAW_FEATURE, DRAW_SELECT and DRAW_LABEL. This identifier is passed to the relevant Renderers, and in turn to the Features to be drawn.

A FeatureLayer is usually guaranteed to have a StoredQueryExtension

See Also:
Map, Layerset, FeatureClass

setSelectionColor

public void setSelectionColor(Color color)
A convenience method for easily creating a SelectionRenderer by specifying the desired color only. The SelectionRenderer will be chosen to be a SimpleRenderer having a single Symbol. For polygon features this will be a semi-transparent solid fill, for line features a thick line, and for point features a solid thick dot.

Parameters:
color - the selection Color
See Also:
SelectableLayer.setSelectable(boolean), setSelectionRenderer(com.esri.mo2.map.draw.Renderer)

search

public Cursor search(QueryFilter f)
Searches the underlying FeatureClass and returns Features that satisfy the given QueryFilter in the form of a Cursor.

If this FeatureLayer has been added to a Map, and the Map has a non-null CoordinateSystem, and the underlying FeatureClass has a different non-null CoordinateSystem, then this search method will transform the geometries of the Features returned into the CoordinateSystem of the Map.

In addition, the Features returned will be limited by the Definition SelectionSet, assuming the Definition is non-null.

Specified by:
search in interface Searchable
Parameters:
f - the Query that defines the search
Returns:
the corresponding Cursor
See Also:
Data

setDefinition

public void setDefinition(SelectionSet sset)
Applies the given SelectionSet to this FeatureLayer. Only those Features defined by the SelectionSet are drawn.

Parameters:
sset - the new Selection definition, null = clear the definition
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - the SelectionSet target is not the same as getSelectableDataset()

getDefinition

public SelectionSet getDefinition()
Returns a copy of the Layer definition.

Returns:
the new selection definition, null = no selection definition
See Also:
setDefinition(com.esri.mo2.data.feat.SelectionSet)

setDefinitionQuery

public void setDefinitionQuery(QueryFilter filter)
Sets a QueryFilter that will be used to construct the Definition property. Unlike a SelectionSet, a QueryFilter can be serialized to AXL. If you call this method, then the Defintion property will be changed. But if you subsequently call setDefinition, the Query will not be changed to match.

Parameters:
filter - the new definition QueryFilter, null = clear the definition
See Also:
setDefinition(com.esri.mo2.data.feat.SelectionSet)

getDefinitionQuery

public QueryFilter getDefinitionQuery()
Returns the QueryFilter used to construct the Layer definition.

Returns:
the QueryFilter definition, null = no definition
See Also:
setDefinitionQuery(com.esri.mo2.data.feat.QueryFilter)
